event: Christianization aligns Poland with Western Europe
Poland emerges as a crowned kingdom
Political fragmentation weakens the Polish state
Teutonic Knights establish power in the Baltic region
Poland and Lithuania unite through dynastic union
Polish-Lithuanian forces defeat Teutonic Knights at Grunwald

Religious tolerance formalized in the Commonwealth
Polish forces halt Ottoman advance at Vienna
Poland disappears from the map of Europe

Germany and the Soviet Union invade Poland
Borders shift west, reshaping cities and population
